title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 31 May 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
06:45 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
06:48 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki

08:03 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:08 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <cjd> has quit

08:48 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
08:52 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki

09:13 <sburjan> has quit  
09:19 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:32 <npm> has quit  
09:53 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
10:24 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <npm> has quit  
10:40 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <vmassol> mflorea: are we using the xwiki-gwt.cfg file possibility in our dev?  
10:47 <mflorea> vmassol: I don't know what xwiki-gwt.cfg is supposed to be, first time I hear of it :)  
10:47 <vmassol> ok good  
10:48 <vmassol> it means we don't use it ;)  
10:48 <vmassol> it's flaky anyway  
10:49 <mflorea> where did you see it?  
10:49 <vmassol> http://pastebin.com/GfGChBBd  
10:50 <mflorea> maybe it was used with the old gwt-api module, which isn't used anymore  
10:50 <mflorea> Ludovic might now what's with this file  
10:50 <mflorea> I mean, https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-gwt/xwiki-platform-gwt-api  
10:51 <mflorea> was used by xwiki-watch  
10:51 <mflorea> the old gwt-api module  
10:57 <sburjan> has quit  
10:57 <msmeria> has quit  
10:57 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:49 <mflorea> vmassol: I don't remember, do we advertise milestone releases on wikimatrix?  
11:50 <mflorea> (it displays only one release version)  
11:51 <vmassol> mflorea: yes  
11:51 <mflorea> ok, thanks  
11:51 <vmassol> we keep the stable + add the milestone one  
11:51 <mflorea> we can't  
11:51 <vmassol> we can  
11:51 <vmassol> make sure you keep both  
11:51 <mflorea> as I said, there's only one input  
11:51 <mflorea> on wikimatrix  
11:51 <vmassol> what we do is:  
11:51 <vmassol> I'll do it  
11:51 <mflorea> not wikipedia  
11:52 <vmassol> done  
11:52 <mflorea> I see, a hack  
11:52 <vmassol> yup  
11:52 <mflorea> :)  
11:52 <mflorea> ok, good to know  
11:52 <mflorea> thanks  
12:09 <mflorea> vmassol: I'm going to replace "XWiki Enterprise" with "XWiki" in the twitter message.  
12:10 <vmassol> ok  
12:10 <vmassol> seems like we've not been very consitent in the past :) https://twitter.com/xwikiorg  
12:10 <vmassol> so it's a good idea  
13:11 <mflorea> has quit  
13:50 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <cjd> has quit  
13:59 <vmassol> msmeria: ping  
13:59 <vmassol> I'm looking at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9192  
13:59 <msmeria> vmassol: yes ?  
14:00 <vmassol> you tried with the released 5.1M1?  
14:00 <msmeria> yes, I did  
14:00 <vmassol> how can I reproduce?  
14:00 <msmeria> I got the war file from Maven this morning  
14:00 <vmassol> how do I install the workspace app?  
14:01 <msmeria> it's on XEM  
14:01 <vmassol> just vanilla XEM?  
14:01 <vmassol> ok will try  
14:01 <msmeria> yes, clean  
14:01 <msmeria> install the workspace template and then create your workspace  
14:02 <msmeria> I did this on hypersql and tomcat 7 if that matters  
14:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:14 <vmassol> has quit  
14:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <vmassol> msmeria: I've done the install steps  
14:42 <vmassol> I've created a new workspace  
14:42 <vmassol> and now I get the DM  
14:42 <vmassol> I'm asked a question  
14:42 <vmassol> "yes this is an upgrade" or "no, this is a new install"  
14:42 <vmassol> what did you choose?  
14:42 <msmeria> vmassol: I didn't get any DM  
14:43 <msmeria> I did a clean install  
14:43 <vmassol> I ran the manager jetty hsqldb zip  
14:43 <vmassol> clean install  
14:43 <msmeria> hmm  
14:43 <msmeria> I used the war file  
14:44 <msmeria> but that should work too  
14:44 <vmassol> in any case there's a bug  
14:44 <vmassol> I shouldn't be asked this question  
14:44 <msmeria> except I don't know why you got the DM on a new clean install  
14:44 <msmeria> yes  
14:44 <vmassol> ATM I don't know enough how workspaces work  
14:44 <vmassol> I'll report it  
14:44 <msmeria> ok  
14:46 <msmeria> vmassol: did you create your own manager jetty hsqldb zip ? because there isn't one release for 5.1m1. there's just this old one http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/manager/xwiki-manager-jetty-hsqldb/5.1-SNAPSHOT/xwiki-manager-jetty-hsqldb-5.1-20130502.184539-13.zip  
14:47 <vmassol> we don't distribute it  
14:47 <vmassol> not sure why  
14:47 <vmassol> but our build creates it  
14:47 <vmassol> so I just built it  
14:47 <msmeria> would be nice to ditribute it on maven at least  
14:47 <msmeria> I see it for snapshots  
14:47 <msmeria> but not for final releases  
14:48 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9194  
14:48 <vmassol> msmeria: the plan is actually to bundle workspaces by default in XE. We need to discuss this on the list to see when make the switch  
14:49 <msmeria> ok then I'll wait for that to happen :)  
14:49 <vmassol> hmm  
14:49 <vmassol> I get the user directory fine  
14:51 <msmeria> vmassol: can you give me a link to your zip file so I can test as well ?  
14:52 <vmassol> there's no link  
14:52 <vmassol> but don't test it  
14:52 <vmassol> it works  
14:52 <msmeria> ok  
14:52 <vmassol> what's important is that your way doesn't work as it should  
14:53 <vmassol> first I need to understans how workspace creation works  
14:53 <msmeria> this bug might be related XWIKI-9191  
14:53 <vmassol> nope  
14:53 <vmassol> I also got that one  
14:57 <vmassol> ok so on http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/WorkspaceManager/Install#Attachments  
14:57 <vmassol> there's a workspace-template.xar  
14:57 <vmassol> which for me contains the Main.UserDirectory page  
14:58 <vmassol> checking how this attachment is created  
15:03 <vmassol> found where the workspace-template-features.xar is attached but not yet where the workspace-template.xar is attached....  
15:06 <msmeria> vmassol: for me the same xar doesn't include the Main.UserDirectory page  
15:07 <vmassol> yes I gathered that, that's why I'm looking where it's generated  
15:07 <vmassol> :)  
15:07 <vmassol> apparently it's not in the buil   
15:08 <vmassol> Enygma`: if you're here and you know, that might save me some minutes ;)  
15:09 <Enygma`> Hi vmassol  
15:09 <vmassol> hello  
15:09 <Enygma`> the workspace template is not bundled by default in XE like it is on XEM  
15:10 <Enygma`> for obvious (cyclic dependency) reasons  
15:10 <Enygma`> so the admin, at install time, attaches the default XE xar (enterprise-ui-all.xar)  
15:10 <vmassol> I didn't have to do this  
15:10 <Enygma`> when the xar is attached to the Install page  
15:10 <Enygma`> and the admin presses Install  
15:10 <vmassol> before I pressed install  
15:10 <vmassol> I already have the template xar  
15:10 <Enygma`>  workspace-template-features.xar is also installed (in addition to the xe xar)  
15:11 <vmassol> yes this one I've seen  
15:11 <Enygma`> are you using XE or XEM?  
15:11 <vmassol> hmm could it be that if I navigate to the Install page  
15:11 <vmassol> it's added without me pressing anything  
15:11 <vmassol> ?  
15:12 <vmassol> ok found         #set ($result = $WikiManager.createWikiTemplate($TEMPLATE\_NAME, '', $TEMPLATE\_PACKAGE))  
15:12 <vmassol> looking at code now  
15:12 <Enygma`> no, you have to add it manually  
15:12 <Enygma`> in XE  
15:13 <vmassol> I'm in xwiki-manager  
15:13 <Enygma`> there is no code that I know of that adds anything automatically  
15:13 <msmeria> Enygma`: he was on XEM  
15:13 <vmassol> jetty/hsqldb  
15:13 <Enygma`> ah, XEM  
15:14 <Enygma`> for XEM, the XE xar is automatically attached at build time  
15:14 <vmassol> I cant find where  
15:14 <vmassol> it must be by using the xwiki-platform-tool-xmldoc-update-plugin plugin  
15:14 <vmassol> since it's added to the install page  
15:14 <Enygma`> yep  
15:14 <Enygma`> let me look  
15:14 <vmassol> but I've searched all poms  
15:15 <Enygma`> vmassol:  https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-manager/blob/master/xwiki-manager-ui/pom.xml#L145  
15:15 <vmassol> that's XemManager  
15:15 <vmassol> not WorkspaceManager  
15:16 <vmassol> ah yes  
15:16 <vmassol> missed the lines below  
15:16 <Enygma`> yes, it's a distribution thing  
15:16 <vmassol> ok thanks  
15:16 <Enygma`> since we can`t do that sort of stuff in Workspaces  
15:16 <vmassol> we 'll need to cleanup all that soon  
15:16 <vmassol> but that's another matter  
15:16 <Enygma`> well, if we drop XEM, it will be cleaned :)  
15:17 <vmassol> almost  
15:17 <Enygma`> maybe the install page can be improved  
15:19 <vmassol> msmeria: real strange, I fixed xwiki-enterprise-ui-all before the 5.1M1 release  
15:19 <vmassol> but it seems you got the version before my fix  
15:19 <vmassol> you have a xwiki-enterprise-ui-all  that's missing the user directory pages  
15:20 <msmeria> vmassol: I used the DW for the UI  
15:20 <vmassol> errr?  
15:20 <vmassol> you said you didn't get the DW  
15:20 <vmassol> you mean for the main wiki  
15:20 <vmassol> ?  
15:20 <msmeria> I didn't get it when I created the workspace  
15:20 <msmeria> that was a different thing  
15:21 <vmassol> ok  
15:21 <msmeria> I got it when I first set up my wiki  
15:21 <vmassol> you manually attached a template xar to the install page?  
15:21 <msmeria> no  
15:21 <vmassol> so it doesn't matter  
15:21 <vmassol> workspaces will use that attachment  
15:22 <vmassol> checking  
15:22 <vmassol> so the user dir is in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/xwiki-enterprise-5.1-milestone-1/xwiki-enterprise-distribution/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/pom.xml  
15:23 <vmassol> now checking the 5.1M1 xar  
15:24 <vmassol> mflorea: there was a release bug  
15:25 <vmassol> and i think I know why  
15:25 <mflorea> vmassol: release bug?  
15:25 <vmassol> if you check the xe-ui-all xar for 5.1M1  
15:26 <vmassol> you'll see it's missing Main.UserDirectory  
15:26 <vmassol> but if you check the tag for 5.1M1:  
15:26 <npm> has quit  
15:26 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/xwiki-enterprise-5.1-milestone-1/xwiki-enterprise-distribution/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/pom.xml  
15:26 <mflorea> how is that a release bug?  
15:26 <vmassol> you'll see it's listed  
15:26 <vmassol> hmm no wait  
15:26 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
15:26 <vmassol> need to check soemthing  
15:29 <mflorea> it's listed only as a feature, not as a dependency..  
15:29 <vmassol> yes htat's what I realized, trying to understand how we build the all xar  
15:30 <mflorea> it needs to be in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/xwiki-enterprise-5.1-milestone-1/xwiki-enterprise-ui/pom.xml I think  
15:30 <mflorea> I see wiki-platform-user-profile-ui there  
15:30 <vmassol> hmm indeed it seems to be missing  
15:30 <vmassol> I don't understand how I got it  
15:32 <vmassol> ok adding it anyway  
15:37 <sdumitriu> has quit

17:38 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
17:51 <bouquetf> has joined #xwiki  
18:44 <sburjan> has quit  
18:54 <vmassol> mflorea: how many failures do you get locally when you execute tests-ui?  
18:54 <vmassol> I get: Failures: 5, Errors: 4  
18:54 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/5686301  
18:55 <mflorea> vmassol: I haven't executed tests-ui entirely locally in a while. Let me see your results.  
18:56 <vmassol> on http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/ there are no erros  
18:56 <vmassol> I hope I don't have local changes that affected it  
18:56 <vmassol> I don't think so since I saw the xe war being downloaded  
18:57 <mflorea> I know UserClassFieldTest.testSaveAndInitialSelection fails sometimes, but I haven't seen the rest failing.  
18:57 <mflorea> from your list  
18:58 <vmassol> ok...  
18:58 <vmassol> I wanted to verify that upgrading to selenium 2.33 was ok  
18:58 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:58 <vmassol> but since I fail locally before upgrading it  
18:58 <vmassol> it might be difficult to know  
18:58 <mflorea> wait  
18:59 <vmassol> anyway runnig again with 2.33 locally now  
18:59 <mflorea> the failures can be caused by a bad combination of selenium and browser version  
18:59 <vmassol> indeed I'm on 20  
18:59 <vmassol> FF 20  
19:00 <vmassol> 2.32.0 and FF 20 to be precise  
19:00 <mflorea> we should check if 2.32 supports native events in FF20  
19:01 <tdelafosse> has quit  
19:01 <mflorea> hmm, I put FF20.0.1 on all agents, so it should work fine  
19:03 <vmassol> hmmm  
19:03 <mflorea> unless there are some issues specific to mac :(  
19:20 <mflorea> has quit  
19:24 <Slashman> has quit  
20:08 <sdumitriu> has quit  
21:00 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
21:01 <timtimc> has joined #xwiki  
21:02 <timtimc> guys, we're looking at xwiki and liferay as two potential solutions to our intranet. would you say one or the other is better suited for this? I know you're biased (maybe ;-) but I'm trying to understand where one or the other might shine  
21:03 <sdumitriu> timtimc: Liferay is more of a portal  
21:04 <sdumitriu> With collaboration capabilies  
21:04 <sdumitriu> XWiki is a web application development platform  
21:04 <sdumitriu> With collaboration at its core  
21:04 <timtimc> sdumitriu: so what would you define a portal as?  
21:04 <sdumitriu> Which one do you need?  
21:04 <timtimc> interesting. we're looking for something to let our users create content, documentation , etc  
21:04 <timtimc> and segregate with permissions  
21:05 <sdumitriu> Then XWiki is better  
21:05 <sdumitriu> From Wikipedia: "Intranet portal: a gateway that unifies access to all enterprise information and applications"  
21:05 <sdumitriu> So a portal is a gateway  
21:05 <timtimc> so when would you use a portal like liferay?  
21:05 <timtimc> hmm...ok....  
21:06 <sdumitriu> I'm not that familiar with Liferay, reading now  
21:06 <sdumitriu> It seems that actually they're quite close to what XWiki does  
21:07 <sdumitriu> They're also a "web application framework"  
21:07 <timtimc> sdumitriu: I'm even more unsure now ;-)  
21:08 <Denis> has quit  
21:12 <sdumitriu> Still, I'd say go with XWiki if you're interested more in having one application as the intranet  
21:12 <sdumitriu> A portal is supposed to be linking to other applications  
21:13 <timtimc> sdumitriu: we want to do that too...I guess my big concern regarding either is ease of use in content creation. I'm not sure how well my users will understand the wiki way of doing things  
21:14 <sdumitriu> Do you mean wiki syntax editing, or the fact that they should edit everything?  
21:14 <timtimc> I guess I'm concerned with things like wiki linking, etc. however, I think I need to dive deeper and give each a fair shot  
21:14 <timtimc> I have about 3400 potential users  
21:16 <sdumitriu> Yep, always try things yourself  
21:16 <sdumitriu> You're the one that knows what you need  
21:16 <timtimc> sdumitriu: k, thanks for your input ;)  
22:13 <Denis> has joined #xwiki

22:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
22:36 <vmassol> has quit  
22:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki
